texts.en: Bernard is a Ugandan male, aged 38 years, who needs a loan to prepare land for planting next season. He hails from the Kyenjojo district, and is the father of eight children between the ages of 11 and 2. He dreams of educating his children and building a permanent house to replace the semi-permanent house that he now owns. A farmer for ten years, he acquired his start up capital from selling Irish potatoes, which is now his major business.

loan.use: to prepare land for planting next season.

loan.name: Twongerumusaruro Group

texts.fr: Zache est client dACB depuis 2011, il est membre du groupe Twongerumusaruro, il est n au Rwanda, son ducation est primaire, il est mari, il a 7 enfants entre 23 et 8 ans et tous ses enfants vont lcole. Cest son premier cycle de prt, Zache va utiliser le prt pour lagriculture de riz, en achetant une petite machine agricole. Ses stratgies sont daugmenter la surface cultiver et lutilisation des felitilisants pour augmenter la production agricole. Dans lavenir, il veut tre capable de sautofinancer et duquer ses enfants jusqu' luniversit et leur accompagner jusqu leur indpendance. Zache est cultivateur des mais aussi.
texts.en: Zache has been a client of ACB since 2011. He is a member of the Twongerumusaruro group. Zache was born in Rwanda and has an elementary school education. He is married with 7 children between the ages of 8 and 23; all the children go to school. This is his first group loan. Zache is going to use the loan to buy a small agricultural machine for cultivating rice. His strategies are to increase his cultivable land and to use fertilizers to increase production. In the future, he wants to be able to self-finance and to educate his children up to the University level and to support them until they are independent. Zache also grows corn.

loan.use: To buy a small farming machine

loan.name: Francis

texts.en: Francis is a Ugandan male, aged 44 years, who needs a loan to pay laborers for weeding his maize plantation. He hails from the Kyenjojo district, and is the father of three children, aged 14, 12 and 5. He dreams of educating his children and building a permanent house to replace the semi-permanent house that he now owns. A farmer for ten years, he acquired his start up capital from accumulated savings from his salary at a local tea factory.

loan.use: to pay laborers for weeding his maize plantation.

loan.name: John

texts.en: John is a businessman who hails from Kyenjojo district. He is a Ugandan male aged 26 years who owns a boutique. He dreams of educating his children and setting up other income generating activities from which he can earn extra income. He acquired his initial capital from brewing alcohol. John wants a loan to purchase women and men's wear to sell in his boutique.

loan.use: To purchase women and men's wear for his boutique

loan.name: Mahugnon As Group

texts.fr: MAHUGNON AS est un groupement compos de vingt personnes qui vivent toutes dans le mme quarter au Bnin. Cest la deuxime fois que ce groupe sollicite un crdit auprs de ALID, afin dlever le niveau de leur activit et de mieux rpondre aux exigences de leur clientle. La reprsentante du groupe du nom de Annick est celle qui a la main leve sur la photo. Annick est ne le 19 Mai 1972 au Bnin. Annick est mre de deux enfants, tous scolariss et qui vivent ensemble avec elle. Annick ne vit plus avec son mari. Annick supporte seule les charges de ses enfants. Pour y arriver, Annick prpare de la nourriture (pte de mas accompagn de poissons frits) qu'elle vend sa clientle. Cette activit lui gnre des revenus l'aidant ainsi subvenir aux besoins de ses enfants. Annick mne cette activit depuis quinze ans et s'approvisionne au Bnin. Ce crdit permettra certainement Annick et son groupe de rehausser leur activit et d'accrotre leur chiffre d'affaire et leur revenu.
texts.en:
Mahugnon As is a group composed of twenty people who live in the same neighborhood in Benin. This is the second time that the group has sought a loan through ALID, in order to raise the level of their business and better respond to their clients' demand.
The group's representative Annick is the one raising her hand in the photo. Annick was born May 19, 1972 in Benin. She is the mother of two children, both in school and living together with her. She is no longer living with her husband; she alone pays her children's expenses. In order to make a living, Annick prepares food (corn paste accompanied by fried fish) which she sells to her clientele. This business generates income for her, helping her meet her children's needs. Annick has been running this business for fifteen years and gets her supplies in Benin.
This loan will surely allow Annick and her group to improve their businesses and increase their sales and their income.

loan.use: to buy corn, condiments, and fresh fish.

loan.name: Stephen

texts.en: Stephen is a Ugandan male aged 36 years who needs a loan to buy maize and beans to sell. He has operated this business for six years. He hails from Kyenjojo district. He is a father of five children who lives in an incomplete permanent house with six people that he takes care of. He dreams of educating his children to a self-reliant level. He acquired his initial capital from growing bananas. He faces the problem of agricultural price fluctuations and his dream is to own a food store.

loan.use: To buy maize and beans to sell

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: To purchase a maize mill.

loan.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace is a married woman who hails from Kyenjojo district. She is a Ugandan female aged 46 years who buys and sells local brew. A mother of four children, she dreams of educating her children and setting up other income-generating activities from which she can earn an extra income. She acquired her initial capital from a sugar cane plantation. Grace wants a loan to purchase alcohol to sell.

loan.use: To purchase alcohol to sell

loan.name: Tuve Mutulo Group

texts.en: Philipo wants a loan to buy coffee to sell. He is a member of Tuve Mutulo, a group which means "we should get out of sleep". The members guarantee each other to access a loan. He is 43 years old and a father to 10 children living in Kyenjojo, Uganda. He deals in agricultural produce sellin. This is a business he has done for 14 years. He started out by selling second clothes from which he saved money to start up the produce business. His goal is to educate his children.

loan.use: To buy coffee to sell

loan.name: Mwanasiti

texts.en:
Mwanasiti is a widow with five children, all of whom have graduated from school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.
For the past three years, she has operated a business selling dried fish. She sells at the market to her neighbors and passersby. In addition, she also operates a business selling cashew nuts, which contributes to her other source of income. Mwanasiti faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. During rainy season, the supply of fish is minimal and doesn't satisfy her customer's needs. She dreams of establishing business blocks to rent in the future.
With the KSHS 20,000 loan, she wants to purchase sacks of dried fish for sale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loan.use: To purchase sacks of dried fish to sell

loan.name: Anonymous Group
loan.use: to buy household items like a television and a generator

loan.name: Fridaus

texts.en:
Fridaus is a married woman who owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.
For the past two years, she has operated a coconut vending business, selling at the market to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. During the dry, hot season, the availability of coconuts is minimal. She dreams of expanding her business in the future.
With the loan of KSHS 10,000, she wants to purchase coconuts and brooms for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loan.use: To purchase coconuts and brooms to sell

loan.name: Firuza

texts.en: Firuza lives in Hamadoni. She is 23 years old and single. She lives with her parents. Her father is a farmer and her mother is a housewife. Firuza has a higher education in pedagogy. She teaches high school. Additionally, in her free time she works in animal husbandry. She raises cattle for sale. She has been doing this work for ten years. She is taking out a loan to buy cattle.

loan.use: to buy cattle.

loan.name: Jenny Elizabeth

texts.es:
Jenny de 45 aos, vive en un cantn llamado Playas uno de los lugares tursticos del Ecuador con una diversa dimensin de mariscos. Es soltera y tiene ya sus hijos mayores de edad. Es comerciante y productora de mariscos.
Empez su negocio cuando compro un pequeo motor fuera de borda y lo puso a pescar para producir camarones y pescados junto con su sobrino para luego comenzar a comercializar estos productos que son muy apetecidos en los restaurantes y hoteles de las costas. Labora de 8H00 am a 11H00 am va a entregar los pedidos a los dueos de restaurantes y hoteles que le hacen y en la tarde se encarga con su hijo y sobrino a ver en la playa mas marisco para las venta en la plazoleta de playas. Con la ayuda del prstamo desea comprar mas productos de mariscos como langostinos, camarones, calamares, para aumentar sus ingresos. La meta de ella es comprarse una embarcacin mas grande para abastecerse de mercadera y comercializar tambin desea que su hijo termine la universidad.
texts.en:
Jenny, age 45, lives in the canton of Playas, a tourist area in Ecuador which has many types of seafood. She is single and has two adult children. She sells and produces seafood.
She began her business when she bought a small outboard motor boat which she used to fish for shrimp and varieties along with her nephew. She began sellling these products to restaurants and hotels along the coast. She works from 8:00 a.m. to 11:00 a.m., then delivers orders to the owners of the restaurants and hotels, and in the afternoons sells more seafood at the beach with her son and nephew. She plans to use the loan to buy more seafood such as prawns, shrimp and squid in order to increase income. Her goal is to buy a larger boat to have more merchandise to sell. She wants her son to finish his college education.

loan.use: To buy seafood such as prawns, shrimp and squid.

loan.name: Efrain Enrique

texts.es: Efrain es un hombre de 57 aos que tiene 3 hijos en las edades de 15 a 27 aos y vive en el municipio de Malambo, donde se dedica a la venta de mercanca variada, cuadros al leo, fritangueria y venta almuerzos. l inici su experiencia de negocio hace 7 aos con una tienda, pero otorg muchos crditos irrecuperables y debi cambiar de actividad para lograr alternativas ms rentables y menos riesgosas; fue as que con el apoyo de sus dos hijos menores, empezaron a vender productos mediante guas especializadas a la que luego agregaron sandalias, bisutera y elaboracin de cuadros al leo; Efrain siempre buscando oportunidades de ingresos donde obtuviera dinero diario, comenz a vender fritos diariamente y los fines de semana almuerzos, porque su meta es progresar en su negocio poco a poco y lograr habilitar un local, para surtirlo con toda la mercanca que l vende, pues su mayor desafo es ofrecerles una educacin de calidad a sus hijos. Su credikiva es el primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundacin Mario Santo Domingo con el comprar 5 docenas de sandalias, 7 oleos, artesanas, cermica, bisutera relojes y materia prima en mayor volumen para elaborar fritos y los almuerzos que vende con una freecuencia semanal, en la actualidad su clientela se ha incrementado da a da y mientras cumple con su sueo, continua esforzndose en la generacin de ingresos familiares mediante sus negocios a travs del cual obtiene una rentabilidad no menor del 51%.
texts.en:
Efrain is a 57-year-old man who has three children between the ages of 15 and 27. He lives in the city of Malambo where he works selling a variety of merchandise such as oil paintings, fried snack foods and prepared lunches. He began his business experience seven years ago with a shop, but he extended credit that in many cases was unrecoverable, and had to change the business so he could achieve alternatives which were more profitable and less risky. Thus, with the support of his two younger children, they began to sell products through specialized guides to which they later added sandals, costume jewelry and the making of oil paintings. Efrain is always looking for income opportunities to bring in money every day. He began selling fried snacks on a daily basis and lunches on the weekends.
His goal is to progress in his business little by little, and be able to set up a shop, and stock it with all the merchandise he sells. His greatest challenge is to be able to offer a quality education to his children. This Kiva credit is his first loan with the Fundacin Mario Santo Domingo. With it he will purchase five dozen pairs of sandals, seven oil paintings, handicrafts, ceramics, costume jewelery and a large volume of basic ingredients for making fried foods and the lunches he sells weekly. Currently his customer base is growing day by day, and, as he makes his dream come true, he continues on diligently to bring in a family income by means of his business, in which he achieves a profitability of no less than 51%.

loan.use: to buy five dozen pairs of sandals, seven oil paintings, handicrafts, ceramics, costume jewelry, clocks and a large volume of basic ingredients for making fried foods.

loan.name: Anthony A.'s Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone is very pleased to present to you the teachers of the Khulafai Rashideen Primary School in Mile Ninety-One, a small town in northern Sierra Leone. Khulafai Rashideen Primary School was founded in 1999 by the Islamic Jamat (Community). The school is staffed with nine able teachers.
Anthony is a teacher at the school and leader of this group of borrowers. The 65-year-old Anthony was born in Mile Ninety One town. He has been in the teaching profession for 35 years now. He is married and has six children. Anthony has requested this loan to buy house building materials to complete his house building project.
Staff from this institution, like many other school staff within SMTs operational areas, comes to SMT to apply for loans. At the end of each month, these teachers can repay the loan out of their monthly salaries. The institutions bursar is directly responsible for deducting the repayment and pays SMT on their behalf.
(Attached to this photo is a snapshots of Ansu, a borrowers who was not able to be present for the group photo).

loan.use: to buy house building materials to complete his house building project

loan.name: Jovial Group

texts.fr:
Mme Fatimata est la reprsentante du groupe JOVIAL. Elle est mari et mre de 4 enfants. Le plus g 18ans et le moins g 9 mois.3de ses enfants vont lcole et elle prend 3 personnes a sa charge.
Mme vend de la patte darachide et du zoom koom (jus de petit mille) depuis 3 ans. Elle sapprovisionne goursi un village du Burkina faso.ses clients sont ses voisins du quartier.
Elle veut s'acheter 9 sacs darachides et un sac de petit mil.
Avec ses bnfices, elle veut soccuper de ses enfants. Elle ambitionne sacheter un machine dcortiquer et craser pour ses arachides et prendre en charge la scolarit de ses enfants afin de leur assurer un avenir radi.
texts.en:
Madame Fatimata is the representative of the Jovial group. She is married and the mother of four children, the oldest of whom is 18 and the youngest, nine months. Three of her children go to school, and she also supports three other people.
Madame Fatimata has been selling peanut butter and "zoom koom" (a drink made from millet and ginger) for three years. She gets her supplies in Goursi, a village in Burkina Faso, and her clients are her neighbors. She would like to buy nine bags of peanuts and one bag of millet.
With her profits, she would like to take care of her children. Her goals are to buy a machine to shell and grind the peanuts and to pay for her children's schooling, in order to make sure they have bright futures.

loan.use: to buy nine bags of peanuts and one bag of millet

loan.name: Mwanasha

texts.en:
Mwanasha is a single woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.
For the past three months, she has operated a natural juice making business. She sells at home to her neighbors and passersby. In addition, she also sells palm leaves for roof thatching, which contributes to her other source of income. Mwanasha faces the major challenge of the high cost of transporting palm leaves from the rural area to her place of operation. She dreams of establishing a boutique shop in the future.
With the KSHS 20,000 loan, she wants to purchase an ice cooler box and start another business selling cloth material. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loan.use: To purchase an ice cooler and start another business selling cloth material

loan.name: Dizzaya

texts.en:
Dizzaya is 21 years old and lives in the town of Kasubi in the Kampala central region of Uganda. She is married and has no children. Dizzaya has a business of a library shop, which she has had for four years.
To help expand her business, Dizzaya has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase video CDs and movies for resale. With the help of the loan from BRAC, Dizzaya hopes to generate greater profits and take care of herself. In the future, Dizzaya hopes to expand her business. Dizzaya is a member of BRACs Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by improving her business.

loan.use: to purchase video CDs and movies for resale.

loan.name: Katiba

texts.en:
Katiba is a married woman with four children. Three of her children attend school and one graduated from school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.
For the past two years, she has operated a caf business, cooking chapatti (flat bread, beans and rice). Katiba also makes natural fruit juice for sale, which contributes to her other source of income. Her potential customers are local villagers and students attending a nearby school. She faces a major challenge of seasonality. During rainy season, the number of customers attending her business is low. She dreams of establishing a restaurant in the future.
With the KSHS 20,000 loan, she wants to purchase 100 Kilograms of rice, sugar and cooking oil. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loan.use: To purchase 100 Kilograms of rice, sugar and cooking oil.

loan.name: Sauya

texts.en:
Sauya is 18 years old and lives in the town of Kasubi in the Kampala central region of Uganda. She is single and has no children. Sauya has a business of selling hand bags for ladys, which she has had for two years.
To help expand her business, Sauya has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more hand bags for resale. With the help of the loan from BRAC, Sauya hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees for herself. In the future, Sauya hopes to own a retail shop.

loan.use: to purchase more hand bags for resale

loan.name: Mwatime

texts.en:
Mwatime is a married woman with three children, one of whom attends school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.
For the past five years, she has operated a business selling palm leaves. She sells from home to her neighbors and passersby. Mwatime faces a major challenge of seasonality. During the dry, hot season, the availability of palm leaves for supply is lower and does not satisfy her customer's demands. She dreams of becoming a wholesale supplier of palm leaves in the future.
With the KSHS 40,000 loan, she wants to purchase bundles of palm leaves for sale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loan.use: To purchase bundles of palm leaves to sell

loan.name: Basoka Kwavula Group

texts.en: Base is a businesswoman who hails from the Kyenjojo district. She is a Ugandan female aged 30 years who owns a boutique. She dreams of educating her five children and setting up other income-generating activities from which she can earn an extra income. She acquired her initial capital from a restaurant she owned. Base is a member of the above-named group where each member guarantees the others in accessing credit .Base wants a loan to buy childrens wear for resale in her boutique.

loan.use: To buy childrens wear to sell.

loan.name: Ritah

texts.en:
Ritah is 20 years old and lives in the town of Kasubi in the Kampala central region of Uganda. She is single and has three children. All of her children are currently in school. Ritah has a business of selling clothes, which she has had for one year.
To help expand her business, Ritah has requested a loan of 400,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more clothes for resale. With the help of the loan from BRAC, Ritah hopes to generate greater profits and pay for school for herself. In the future, Ritah hopes to complete her studies. Ritah is a member of BRACs Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by helping her learn how to save money.

loan.use: to purchase more clothes for resale.

loan.name: Tunu

texts.en:
Tunu is a married woman with three children, one of whom attends school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.
Tunu has operated a business selling mahamri (dumplings) for the past 10 years, selling at the market and from home to her neighbors and passersby. She dreams of expanding her business in the future.
With the loan of KSHS 10,000, she wants to purchase one sack of sugar and a bundle of wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loan.use: To purchase one sack of sugar and a bundle of wheat flour.

loan.name: Hacia Adelante 1, 2 & 3 Group

texts.en:
Glenny is one of the members of the group Hacia adelante 1, 2 & 3 (Going Forward). She makes her home in a simple structure with her parents. She operates a business where she sells underwear, both in her house and by walking. She is a young hardworking woman just 26 years old, whose challenges are to do business, get a good income and to start studying in the university.
Glenny is excited to be taking her second loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She has had her business for almost one year, which she started with her first Esperanza loan. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business by purchasing a big quantity of underwear at wholesale prices.
Her group is located in San Pedro de Macoris, a city famous for baseball players and the sugar cane industry. The main economic activities are a free trade zone and a cement factory. Their community is a tourist area outside San Pedro and Santo Domingo, which makes this community very active. There are a lot of businesses and people working in the street. Also, this town is close to the main airport of the Dominican Republic.

loan.use: to buy underwear at wholesale prices.

loan.name: Milly

texts.en:
Milly is 21 years old and lives in the town of Kasubi in the Kampala central region of Uganda. She is married and has two children. All of her children are currently in school. Milly has a business of tailoring, which she has had for eight years.
To help expand her business, Milly has requested a loan of 400,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more materials for making clothes for resale. With the help of the loan from BRAC, Milly hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees for her children. In the future, Milly hopes to buy a plot of land. Milly is a member of BRACs Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by helping her improve in her business.

loan.use: to purchase more materials for making clothes for resale.

payment.comment: Over-reported by partner. Reduced to local price.

loan.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a married woman with five children, one of whom attends school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.
Fatuma has operated a palm leaf selling business for the past 10 years, selling at the market and from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality. During the rainy season, it becomes difficult for the customers to access her business. She dreams of expanding her business and supplying as a wholesaler in the future.
With the Kshs 15,000 she wants to purchase bundles of palm leaves for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loan.use: To purchase bundles of palm leaves for resale.

loan.name: Vicky

texts.en: Vicky sells sugar, cooking oil, rice and onions. She is 40 years old, married and has 6 children. Vicky took out a loan to stock more sugar, cooking oil, rice and onions to sell. She hopes to expand her business with extra profits.

loan.use: to stock more sugar, cooking oil, rice and onions to sell.

loan.name: Susan

texts.en: Susan sells beans and sugar. She is 28 years old, married with 2 children, and both of them go to school. Susan took out a loan to stock more beans and sugar to sell. She hopes to expand her business in the future with extra profits.

loan.use: to stock more beans and sugar to sell.

loan.name: Diana Patricia

texts.es: Diana vive en la bella ciudad de Cartagena de Indias con su pequeo hijo de 1 ao de edad que es su mximo impuso para el arduo trabajo diario, con tal de lograr su bienestar y ofrecerle mejores posibilidades de xito futuro. Ella tiene un negocio donde vende ropa y accesorios, que inici hace un ao cuando no encontraba empleo y debi prepararse, generar ingresos y sostener a su beb. Con la ayuda de sus familiares, ella emprendi un pequeo almacn donde hoy vende todo tipo de ropa, inicialmente comenz la lnea femenina, gradualmente adicion la lnea masculina y aprovech su punto de venta para ofrecer las mercancas ms solicitadas por su clientela y con ello ha ganado mucha aceptacin en su sector. El Credikiva es es su primer financiamiento con la Fundacin Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprar vestidos femeninos, masculinos e infantil, preparndose para las prximas celebracin del da del padre, pues le han hecho pedidos en el marco de esta fecha, porque las familias quieren verse elegante al compartir en este da. Su sueo es ampliar su negocio logrando todos los das nuevos clientes, para aumentar sus ingresos y sacar a su hijo adelante.
texts.en:
Diana lives in the beautiful city of Cartagena de Indias with her 1 year-old son who is the main reason for all her hard work. She works hard to provide for him and so that she can offer him better possibilities for future success. Diana has a business where she sells clothes and accessories. She started her business a year ago when she wasn't able to find work. She had to make income and support her baby.
With the support of her family members, Diana set up a small store where she sells all kinds of clothes. She started out selling women's clothes but gradually started selling men's clothes too. She made the most of her sales location, offering merchandise which was most in demand with her customers. She has gained a lot of customers in her area.
This Kiva loan is Diana's first loan with Fundacin Mario Santo Domingo. She will use it to buy women's, men's and children's clothes, in preparation for Father's Day as customers have made orders with her for this date because families want to dress up in order to share the day together.
Diana's dream is to expand her business and continue to attract new customers so that she can increase her income and get her son ahead in life.

loan.use: to buy women's, men's and children's clothes

loan.name: Anonymous Group
loan.use: to buy fertilizer and pay for labor

loan.name: Nancy Amparo

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal SAN JOSE DE URUBAMBA; El banco est ubicado en el distrito de Urubamba, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Nancy Amparo; ella tiene 43 aos de edad y es soltera y tiene 4 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de cubrecamas, sabanas y cortinas, ella vende en forma ambulatoria en el mercado de Urubamba, la socia tambin trabaja en la municipalidad de Urubamba en el rea de almacen,la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio de venta de cortinas, sabanas y cubrecamas. La socia solicita el prstamo para comprar mercadera de variedad de sabanas, cubrecamas y sabanas.
La socia est feliz por el prstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Here is a member of the communal bank "San Jose de Urubamba". It is located in the district of Urubamba, belonging to the province of Urubamba and the department of Cusco.
Her name is Nancy Amparo. She is 43 years old, single, and she has 4 children. She alternates her daily activities with her business selling comforters, bed sheets, and curtains. She makes her sales itinerantly in the market in Urubamba. She also works in the municipality of Urubamba, in the warehousing sector. She wants to expand and improve her business selling curtains, bed sheets, and bedspreads. She requires a loan to purchase merchandise including a variety of bed sheets, bedspreads and linen.
She is happy for the loan and she is committed to making her loan payments.

loan.use: to purchase a variety of bed sheets, bed spreads, and linen.

loan.name: Carmen

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal SAN JOSE DE URUBAMBA; El banco est ubicado en el distrito de Urubamba, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Carmen; ella tiene 38 aos de edad y es soltera y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de tienda de abarrotes, ella vende productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azcar, fideos, galletas entre otros productos, la socia trabaja desde las 6:00 a.m hasta las 10:00 p.m, por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de tienda de abarrotes. La socia solicita el prstamo para comprar productos al por mayor para vender en la tienda de abarrotes.
La socia est feliz por el prstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Carmen belongs to the "San Jos de Urubamba" community bank which is located in Urubamba district, in Urubamba province, in Cusco department.
Carmen is 38 years old, single, and has two children. She divides her time between her daily activities and her grocery store business. Carmen sells essential household products such as rice, sugar, noodles, cookies, etc. She works from 6.00am to 10.00pm. Through her business, she gets her children ahead in life. Carmen would like to expand her grocery store business. She is requesting this loan to buy products wholesale to sell in her store.
Carmen is happy to be receiving this loan and pledges to make her repayments on time.

loan.use: to buy products wholesale to sell in her grocery store

loan.name: Hacia Adelante 4, 5 & 6 Group

texts.en:
Fredesvinda is one of the members of the group Hacia adelante 4, 5 & 6 (Going Forward). This group is composed of 15 entrepreneurs, dedicated to selling clothing, shoes, cosmetics, food and many other businesses. Their community is a tourist area outsiD. San Pedro and Santo Domingo. That makes this community very active, a lot of business going on and people working in the street; also this town is close to the main airport of the Dominican Republic.
Fredesvinda makes her home in a simple structure with her husband and their three children. They are living together and they are looking to progress together by working and bringing income to the home.
Fredesvinda operates a business where she sells clothing. She is excited to be taking her 9th loan with Esperanza. She has had her business for six years. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business by buying other products like shoes, underwear and more clothes. She will save part of her profits and invest the rest in her business. Through this business she wants to make her dreams come true, especially to have her own house.
This Esperanza associate began with us because she wants to improve her family life by starting doing business. Her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients generally, many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti.

loan.use: to buy other products like shoes and underwear and also more clothes to sell.

loan.name: Maruja

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal SAN JOSE DE URUBAMBA; El banco est ubicado en el distrito de Urubamba, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Maruja; ella tiene 39 aos de edad y es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de tienda de abarrotes, ella vende fideos, arroz, azcar, harinas, aceite y golosinas, la socia trabaja desde las 5:00 a.m hasta las 10:00 p.m, por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar la tienda de abarrotes. La socia solicita el prstamo para comprar productos como arroz, azcar, leche y fideos al por mayor.
La socia est feliz por el prstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Maruja is a member of the "San Jos de Urubamba" community bank which is located in Urubamba district, in Urubamba province, in Cusco department.
Maruja is 39 years old, lives with her partner, and has two children. She divides her time between her daily activities and her grocery store business where she sells noodles, rice, sugar, flour, oil and candies. She works from 5.00am to 10.00pm and, through her business, she gets her children ahead in life. Maruja would like to expand and improve her grocery store. She is requesting this loan to buy products such as rice, sugar, milk and noodles wholesale.
Maruja is happy to be receiving her loan and pledges to make her repayments on time.

loan.use: to buy products such as rice, sugar, milk and noodles wholesale

loan.name: Juana Francisca

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal SAN JOSE DE URUBAMBA; El banco est ubicado en el distrito de Urubamba, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Juana Francisca; ella tiene 43 aos de edad y es soltera y tiene 1 hijo; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de comida, ella es propietaria de un restaurant donde prepara diferentes platos de comida en las diferentes festividades que se realiza en el distrito de Urubamba como es la fiesta del Sr de Torrechayoc que es una fiesta tradicional en el distrito de Urubamba, la socia tambin vende cerveza y ponches, por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar el servicio de restaurant. La socia solicita el prstamo para comprar productos para cocinar como carne, pollo y verduras.
La socia est feliz por el prstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Juana Francisca is a member of the "San Jos de Urubamba" community bank which is located in Urubamba district, in Urubamba province, in Cusco department.
Juana Francisca is 43 years old, single, and has one child. She divides her time between her daily activities and her business selling food. She is the owner of a restaurant where she prepares a number of different dishes. During the different festivities that take place in Urubamba district such as the 'Sr de Torrechayoc' fiesta (a traditional fiesta in this district) she also sells beer and punch. Through her business, Juana gets her children ahead in life. She would like to expand and improve her restaurant service. She is requesting this loan to buy food products to cook such as meat, chicken and vegetables.
Juana Francisca is happy to be receiving a loan and pledges to make her repayments on time.

loan.use: to buy food products to cook such as meat, chicken and vegetables

loan.name: Mpiriggwa Twezimbe Group

texts.en: Most successful businesses in Uganda are built out of unwavering diligence, persistence and a sheer determination to succeed. Many people see running a business as a means to an end in their quest to extricate themselves out of poverty. 34-year-old enterprising Sarah is one such person. This happily married mother of 4 has been plying her charcoal sales business in Mityana for the past 2 years. She ekes out further profits from selling bananas. She also has a farm. Before she ventured into this business she was engaged in a tailoring business. She says her weekly sales profits are 30,000 shillings. With this loan, Sarah says she is going to purchase more bags of charcoal to resell.

loan.use: to buy more charcoal to resell

loan.name: Andrea

texts.es: Andrea forma parte del Banco comunal El Progreso perteneciente a la comuna de Independencia, ciudad de Santiago. Ella se dedica a la orfebrera, trabajo artstico realizado sobre utensilios o adornos de metales preciosos, o aleaciones de ellos, mezcla slida homognea de metales. Se dedica a ste oficio desde hace 25 aos, ya que su padre ha practicado ste oficio toda su vida, por lo que tambin ha sido heredado, adems su padre cuenta con su propio taller y joyera. Po lo que Andrea aprovecha de fabricar su artesana en ste taller, para lo cual debe comprar el gas y oxigeno para fundir los metales. A Andrea le va muy bien en ste negocio, tiene bastante clientela frecuente, entre estos se encuentran trabajadores de los hospitales y consultorios. Con el crdito comprar metales como oro y plata, adems de pagar el gas y oxigeno que utiliza en el taller de su padre. Sus metas son tener su propio taller y joyera, para fabricar y vender sus productos. Adems anhela comprarse una camioneta para el traslado de mercadera y maquinarias. Junto con esto pretende incursionar en otro rubro que tambin le permita generar otros ingresos, ste rubro sera el de produccin y venta de comida para los almuerzos de algunos obreros de la construccin, lugar donde trabaja su marido. Andrea vive junto a su madre, su marido y sus tres hijos de 18 aos, 9 aos y 3 aos de edad. Sus sueos son brindarles a sus hijos una mejor calidad de vida, que sta sea ms confortable. Adems pretende dejar su negocio como herencia a sus hijos. Andrea est muy contenta y agradecida del crdito brindado por Fondo esperanza, ya que le ha servido para invertir en su negocio. Respecto a las reuniones con las dems socias, existe mucho respeto en el grupo. Independencia es una de las 34 comunas que componen la ciudad de Santiago (capital de Chile), ubicada en el sector centro-norte. Surgi a fines del siglo XIX como un sector tradicional de la ciudad. Su eje principal es la Av. Independencia, por la cual pasaba el antiguo Camino del Inca, puerta de entrada por el norte, a la ciudad de Santiago. Dada su amplia poblacin indgena, en Independencia se encuentra el Centro Cultural Indgena de Chile. Cuenta tambin con importantes construcciones histricas, entre ellas 6 monumentos histricos de Chile.
texts.en:
Andrea is part of the communal bank "El Progreso" and lives in the communal area of Independencia in the city of Santiago. She works in artistic metalworking, creating utensils and adornments out of precious metals and alloys - a solid mix of several metals. She has worked in this area for 25 years, inheriting the skill from father who has been practicing the craft all his life. Her father has his own workshop and jewelery store. Andrea takes advantage of this workshop to create her handcrafted articles, so she must pay for the gas and oxygen used to work the metals.
This business is going very well for Andrea. She has quite a few frequent clients, including workers from the hospitals and medical centers. With this loan she will buy metals like gold and silver and pay for the gas and oxygen she uses in her father's workshop.
Her goals are to have her own workshop and jewelery store to make and sell her products. Also she hopes to buy a van to move her merchandise and machinery. Along with this she also plans to begin work in another area that will allow her to generate more income. This will be the production and sale of meals for the lunches of some of the construction workers from her husband's workplace.
Andrea lives with her mother and her husband and their three children - 18, 9, and 3 years old. Her dream is to provide a better quality of life for her children so they can be more comfortable. She also hopes to leave her business as an inheritance for her children.
Andrea is pleased and grateful for the credit provided by Fondo Esperanza since it has allowed her to invest in her business. Regarding the meetings with the other members, there is a great deal of respect in the group.
Independencia is one of the 34 municipalities that make up the city of Santiago (capitol of Chile), located in the center-north sector. It grew around the end of the 19th century as a traditional area of the city. Its main axis is Independence Avenue, the old route of the ancient Road of the Inca and the northern entrance to the city of Santiago. Given its abundant indigenous population the Indigenous Cultural Center of Chile is located here. Independencia also boasts of important historic constructions, including six historic monuments of Chile.

loan.use: buy metals like gold and silver and pay for the gas and oxygen she uses in her father's workshop.

loan.name: Elmer Edgar

texts.es:
Elmer es un cliente de 30 aos de edad que vive junto a su esposa e hijo en la zona rural del distrito de Jayanca Lambayeque. Las actividades principales de esta comunidad son la agricultura y ganadera.
Elmer se dedica a la agricultura desde hace ms de 5 aos, l cuenta con terreno agrcola donde cosecha maz que luego comercializa a clientela ya establecida, quienes son principalmente pobladores de su zona.
Elmer es un hombre muy trabajador pues sabe que su esfuerzo beneficia a su familia. l tiene muchos deseos de darle lo mejor a su hijo y de mejorar su calidad de vida.
Elmer solicita a Edpyme Alternativa un crdito de 2000 nuevos soles que invertir en mejorar su cultivo de maz, comprando los abonos y fertilizantes adecuados y tambin para el deshierbo de este. Esto le permitir obtener ganancias (producto de su cosecha) e ir creciendo econmicamente.
Elmer estara muy agradecido de concedrsele el crdito, pues le ayudara a aumentar sus ganancias para darle mayores comodidades a su familia.
texts.en:
Elmer is 30 years old and lives with his wife and son in the rural area of Jayanca district, Lambayeque. The main business activities in this community are farming and livestock raising.
Elmer has been farming for more than five years. He has a plot of farmland where he grows corn which he then sells to established customers who are mainly residents of his area.
Elmer is a very hard-working man as he knows that his efforts benefit his family. He has a great desire to provide his son with the very best and to improve his quality of life.
Elmer is requesting a loan for 2,000 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa. He will invest this money in improving his corn crop, buying appropriate manures and fertilizers and weeding his land. This will enable him to make profits (from his harvest) and continue growing financially. Elmer is very grateful for this loan as it will help him to increase his profits which will enable him to provide his family with more comforts.

loan.use: to buy manures and fertilizers for his crops and to weed his land

loan.name: Dominga

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal SAN JOSE D. URUBAMBA; El banco est ubicado en el distrito D. Urubamba, perteneciente a la provincia D. Urubamba y departamento D. Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Dominga; ella tiene 53 aos D. edad y es casada y tiene 7 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio D. venta D. comida, ella prepara distintos platos como anticuchos que es un plato a base D. carne con papas hechas en parrilla, tambin venD. caldo D. gallinas y asado D. carne, ella venD. en forma ambulatoria en el distrito D. Yucay,la socia por medio D. este negocio saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio D. venta D. comida. La socia solicita el prstamo para comprar productos para cocinar como arroz, papa, gallina, carne y lea.
La socia est feliz por el prstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos D. su cuota.
texts.en:
Dominga is a member of the "San Jos D. Urubamba" community bank which is located in Urubamba district, in Urubamba province, in Cusco department.
Dominga is 53 years old, married, and has seven children. She divides her time between her daily activities and her business selling food. She prepares different dishes such as 'anticuchos' (a grilled meat and potato dish). She also sells chicken soup and barbecued meats. She makes her sales as an itinerant street vendor in Yucay district. Through this business, she gets her children ahead in life. Dominga would like to expand and improve her food business. She is requesting this loan so that she can buy products to cook such as rice, potatoes, chicken and meat. She will also buy firewood.
Dominga is happy to be receiving a loan and pledges to make her repayments on time.

loan.use: to buy food products to cook such as rice, potatoes, chicken, meat, and also firewood

loan.name: America

texts.es:
America es una mujer de 62 aos de edad que vive en la zona rural del distrito de Jos Leonardo Ortiz Chiclayo. America siempre ha sido una mujer trabajadora y luchadora por el bienestar de sus hijos, quienes ahora son personas integras e independientes.
La actividad que desarrolla America es la venta de comidas en el interior de un mercado del distrito de Chiclayo. America tiene gran experiencia en su negocio pues hace 20 aos lo viene realizando. Ella se inicio como ayudante de cocina y su esfuerzo y dedicacin le permiti tener su propio puesto de comida. Los clientes de America estn muy satisfechos con el servicio que ella brinda.
America tiene muchos deseos de mejorar su calidad de vida y por eso solicita a Edpyme Alternativa un crdito de 3000 nuevos soles para mejorar su vivienda, exactamente para la reparacin de sus servicios higinicos y cocina que se encuentran en estado crtico. Ella desea arduamente esto y estara muy agradecida de concedrsele el crdito pues le sera de gran utilidad.
America es un cliente reactivado de nuestra institucin y solo ha trabajado con nosotros.
texts.en:
America is a 62 year-old woman who lives in the rural area of Jos Leonardo Ortiz district, Chiclayo. America has always been a hard-working woman who has worked hard for the good of her children. Her children are now grown up and live independently.
America's business activity is selling food in a market in Chiclayo district. She has a lot of experience in her business, which she has been working in for 20 years. She started out as an assistant cook and, through her efforts and commitment, she was able to acquire her own food stall. America's customers are very satisfied with the service that she provides.
America has a great desire to improve her quality of life and, for this reason, she has requested a loan for 3,000 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa which she will use to improve her home. She will repair her bathroom and kitchen facilities which are in a critical condition. She would really like to be able to carry out this work and would be very grateful for the loan as it would help her a lot.
America is a return client of our institution and has only worked with us.

loan.use: to repair the bathroom and kitchen facilities in her home

loan.name: Leonardo

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal SAN JOSE DE URUBAMBA; El banco est ubicado en el distrito de URUBAMBA, perteneciente a la provincia de URUBAMBA y departamento de Cusco.
El socio es el Sr. Leonardo; el tiene 54 aos de edad y es casado y tiene 3 hijos; El socio alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de helados y venta de pasteles, el distribuye los helados y pasteles a las diferentes tiendas de abarrotes del distrito de Urubamba y tambin lleva a lugares como Maras, Izcuchaca y Chinchero, el trabaja en forma independiente, el socio quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio de venta de pasteles y helados. El socio solicita el prstamo para comprar insumos como harina, mantequilla, azcar y fruta para preparar los helados y pasteles.
El socio est feliz por el prstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Leonardo belongs to the San Jose de Urubamba Communal Bank. The bank is located in the Urubamba district, Urubamba province, Cusco department.
Leonardo is 54 years old, married, and has three children. He alternates his daily activities with his business of selling ice cream and cake. He distributes the ice creams and cakes to different grocery stores in the Urubamba district. He also takes them to places like Maras, Izcuchaca, and Chinchero. He works in an independent manner.
He wants to expand and improve his business of selling ice cream and cake. He is requesting a loan to buy supplies like flour, butter, sugar, and fruit to make the ice creams and cakes.
He is very happy about the loan, and he pledges to make all of his payments.

loan.use: to buy supplies like flour, butter, sugar, and fruit to make ice creams and cakes.

loan.name: Gloria

texts.es:
Gloria tiene 48 aos de edad ella vive con sus 2 hijos y su esposo en una pequea comunidad rural del distrito de Tambogrande Piura.
Gloria cuenta con un pequeo restaurante de comida marina ubicado en su propio domicilio. Ella tiene este negocio desde hace 7 aos y cuenta con gran demanda y con clientes ya establecidos en la zona. Su negocio esta adecuadamente condicionado y lo abre los fines de semana y los lunes, el resto de la semana Gloria se dedica a ayudar a su esposo con sus labores y a cuidar a sus hijos.
El esposo de Gloria tambin colabora con su negocio, cuando no esta realizando sus labores agrcolas. l cuenta con cultivos de limn y mango que actualmente se encuentran en produccin.
Gloria ha solicitado a Edpyme Alternativa un crdito de 1000 nuevos soles que utilizar para la compra de cerveza para su restaurante, pues sus clientes siempre acompaan sus platos picantes con esta bebida que tan bien le combina.
texts.en:
Gloria, age 48, lives with her two children and her husband in a small rural community in the Tambogrande Piura district.
Gloria has a small seafood restaurant located in her home. She has had this business for seven years. There is a great demand for her food, and she has established customers in the area. Her business is suitably equipped, and it is open on the week-ends and on Mondays.
The rest of the week Gloria helps her husband with his work and takes care of her children. Glorias husband also collaborates with her in her business when he is not doing his farm work. He has lemon and mango crops that are now producing.
Gloria has requested a loan for 1,000 soles from Edpyme Alternativa to buy beer for her restaurant. Her customers always accompany her spicy dishes with this drink, which goes so well with them.

loan.use: to buy beer for her restaurant.

loan.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa es una madre de familia de 44 aos de edad, ella vive con su esposo y sus hijos en una comunidad rural del distrito de San Pedro ubicado en Pacasmayo - La Libertad. A pesar de vivir en una zona rural la calidad de vida de esta familia es buena.
Rosa cuenta, desde hace 3 aos, con una bodega en su domicilio, en esta vende todo tipo de abarrotes (fideos, arroz, azcar, aceite, huevos, etc.), algunas frutas y verduras, bebidas y golosinas. A pesar de tener una tienda pequea, esta est bien surtida y cuenta con clientes fijos.
Rosa desea invertir en su negocio para que este le produzca mayores ganancias y as poder mejorar su calidad de vida. Ella ha solicitado a Edpyme Alternativa un prstamo de 1000 nuevos soles que repartir en el mejoramiento de su cocina y en comprar nuevos productos para su bodega.
Rosa tiene muchos deseos de arreglar su cocina y de que su negocio crezca para poder hacer arreglos en su hogar, por su propia cuenta. Este crdito le sera de gran utilidad.
texts.en:
Rosa is a 44 year old mother. She lives with her husband and children in a rural community in the district of San Pedro located in Pacasmayo - La Libertad. Despite living in a rural area, they have a good quality of life.
For the past 3 years Rosa has been running a store out of her house where she sells all types of grocery products (noodles, rice, sugar, oil, eggs, etc.), some fruits and vegetables, drinks and sweets. Even though her store is small it is well-stocked and she has a steady clientele.
Rosa would like to invest in her business so that she can increase her income and improve her quality of life. She is requesting a loan from Edpyme Alternativa for 1000 nuevos soles [Peruvian currency] to make improvements to her kitchen and buy new products for her store.
Rosa is eager to make improvements to her kitchen. She wants her business to grow so that she is able to make other improvements in her home. This loan will be very useful.

loan.use: make improvements to her kitchen and stock her store.

location.town: San Pedro de Lloc - Pacasmayo - La Libertad

loan.name: Irene Emilia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal SAN JOSE DE URUBAMBA; El banco est ubicado en el distrito de Urubamba, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Irene Emilia; ella tiene 46 aos de edad y es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de pasto (se usa para alimento de cuyes y ganados),ella vende en forma ambulatoria en las diferentes calles del distrito Urubamba, ella trabaja desde las 9:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m, por medio de este pequeo negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio de venta de pasto. La socia solicita el prstamo para comprar pasto al por mayor.
La socia est feliz por el prstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Seora Irene Emilia is a member of the communal bank "San Jose de Urubamba" located in the district and province of Urubamba in the department of Cusco.
She is 46 years old, lives with her partner and has 2 children. She makes a living selling animal feed (used to feed guinea pigs and livestock). She makes her sales as a street vendor on the different streets in the Urubamba district. She works from 9:00 am until 6:00 pm. This business helps her to provide for her children. She wants to expand and improve her feed sales. She is requesting a loan to buy feed wholesale.
She is happy about the loan and is committed to making her payments on time.

loan.use: purchase wholesale animal feed.

loan.name: Agatinde Group

texts.fr: Simon est client dACB depuis 2011, il est membre du groupe Agatinde, il est n au Rwanda, son ducation est de 8 ans de lcole primaire, il est mari, il est cultivateur de riz, il a 30 ans, il a 3 enfants entre 12 et 1 an, 2 de ses enfants va lcole. Cest son premier cycle de prt, Simon va utiliser le prt pour lagriculture de riz en paiement de main duvre et achat dengrais chimique. Sa stratgie est suivre les tapes appropries et selon la saison pour augmenter la production. Dans lavenir, il veut un augmenter la surface cultiver.
texts.en: Simon has been an ACB customer since 2011 and is a member of the Agatinde group. He was born in Rwanda and attended primary school for eight years. He is married, 30 years old and has three children between one and twelve years old, two of whom attend school. He is a rice grower by trade. This is the first loan that he has sought and he will use it to pay labour costs and to purchase chemical fertiliser. His plan is to follow the necessary steps and to harvest his crops during the correct seasons so that he can boost production further. In future he would like to extend the area of land that he cultivates.

loan.use: to purchase fertilisers and pay labour costs

loan.name: Sixto

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal PEROLNIYOC; El banco est ubicado en el distrito de URUBAMBA, perteneciente a la provincia de URUBAMBA y departamento de Cusco.
El socio es el Sr. Sixto; el tiene 38 aos de edad y es conviviente y tiene 1 hijo; El socio alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de carpintera, el hace trabajos como mesas, sillas y puertas, el trabaja desde las 7:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m y luego lo vende en forma independiente, el socio quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio de carpintera. El socio solicita el prstamo para comprar madera, pegamento y pintura para hacer las mesas, sillas y puertas.
El socio est feliz por el prstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Seor Sixto is a member of the communal bank "Perolniyoc" located in the district and province of Urubamba in the department of Cusco.
Seor Sixto is 38 years old, lives with his partner and has one child. He alternates his daily activities with his carpentry business. He makes things like tables, chairs and doors. He works from 7:00 am until 5:00 pm and then he sells his products independently. He wants to expand and improve his carpentry business. He is requesting a loan to buy wood, glue and paint to make tables, chairs and doors.
He is happy about the loan and is committed to making his payments on time.

loan.use: buy wood, glue and paint to make tables, chairs and doors for his carpentry business.

loan.name: El Cedro Group

texts.es:
En el estado de Veracruz en el municipio de Tezonapa Existe una comunidad llamada el cedro en el cual existe una UDE (grupo de mas de diez personas que tienen una cuenta en el banco y tienen que reunirse semanal o quincenalmente para hacer sus pagos)la cual lleva el mismo nombre en honor a la comunidad que habitan, este grupo esta formado por 11 integrantes
El representante del grupo se llama Emilia tiene la edad de 52 aos, estudio solo la primaria, esta casada y tiene 3 hijos de los cuales dos son mujeres y uno hombre de nombres Graciela de 24 aos, Vicente de 28 aos y Vianey de 21, los cuales ya estan casados, actualmente solo vive con su esposo. Ella nos platica que hace mas de 5 aos ella y su familia siembran cafe y lo cosechan, ella su esposo y su hijo se encargan del cuidado de sus siembras de regarlo ponerle abonos y cuando llega el tiempo del cultivo del cafe le dan trabajo a algunas personas de la comunidad, despues de cosechar venden el cafe, nos platica que antes se lo vendian a un seor que tenia un molino pero hace un par de aos cerro su molino y ahora lo venden en la comunidad y en algunas otras cercanas. ellos enden el cafe algunas veces en cereza(que es cuando esta maduro) y otras veces en Oro(grano). Ella necesita este credito para invertirlo en abonos y fertilizantes para su siembra, tambien nos platico que espera en un futuro seguir trabajando ya que en estos tiempos la situacion economica esta muy dura y solo trabajando se puede salir adelante.(alguna de las personas que salen en la foto son amigos y vecinos que estaba ahi en ese momento y quisieron salir en la foto)
Los otros integrantes se llaman: Senorina - venta de antojitos Camerina - venta de ropa Maria Lucrecia - venta de abarrotes Eva - venta de abarrotes Yuridia - club nutricion Rosalia - venta de abarrotes eulalia- venta zapatos elodia-venta de catalago dora maria -tienda ropa genoveva- zapatos
texts.en:
In the State of Veracruz, in the town of Tezonapa, there is a community called El Cedro in which there is an 'UDE' (a group of more than ten people who have an account with the community bank and must meet up every one or two weeks to make their payments). This group was named in honor of the community in which its members live. It has eleven members.
The group's representative is called Emilia. She is 52 years old and has an elementary school level of education. Emilia is married and has three children (two daughters and one son): 24 year-old Graciela, 28 year-old Vicente and 21 year-old Vianey, who are all married. Currently, Emilia only lives with her husband. She tells us that she and her family have been growing and harvesting coffee for more than five years. Emilia, her husband and her son look after the crops, watering them and applying fertilizers. When the time comes to harvest the coffee, they provide work to some people in their community. After harvesting, they sell the coffee. Emilia tells us that they used to sell their coffee to a gentleman who owned a grinder but he closed down a couple of years ago and now they sell their produce within their own community and in some other nearby communities. They sometimes sell coffee cherries (which is when the coffee is mature) and sometimes they sell the beans.
Emilia needs this loan to invest in fertilizers for her crops. She tells us that she hopes to continue working in the future because the financial situation is very hard these days and you can only get ahead in life by working.
Some of the people who appear in this photo are friends and neighbors who were present when the photo was taken and wanted to appear in it.
The other members of the group are:
Senorina - snack sales Camerina - clothing sales Maria Lucrecia - grocery sales Eva - grocery sales Yuridia - nutrition club Rosalia - grocery sales Eulalia - shoe sales Elodia - catalog sales Dora maria - clothes store Genoveva - shoe sales

loan.use: to grow coffee

loan.name: Bertha

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal PEROLNIYOC; El banco est ubicado en el distrito de Urubamba, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Bertha; ella tiene 31 aos de edad y es conviviente y tiene 1 hijo; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de restaurant, ella prepara desayunos, almuerzos y cenas, ella trabaja desde las 5:00 a.m hasta las 9:00 p.m, por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar el local de restaurant. La socia solicita el prstamo para comprar mesas y productos para cocinar como pollo, carne y verduras.
La socia est feliz por el prstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Bertha belongs to the Perolniyoc Communal Bank. The bank is located in the Urubamba district, Urubamba province, Cusco department.
Bertha, age 31, has a life partner and one child. She alternates her daily activities with her restaurant business. She makes breakfasts, lunches, and dinners. She works from 5:00 a.m. until 9:00 p.m. It is through this business that she gets her children ahead.
She wants to expand and improve her restaurant site. She is requesting a loan to buy tables and products for cooking like chicken, meat, and vegetables.
She is happy about the loan, and she pledges to make her payments.

loan.use: to buy tables and products for cooking like chicken, meat, and vegetables.

loan.name: Guillermina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal PEROLNIYOC; El banco est ubicado en el distrito de Urubamba, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Guillermina; ella tiene 46 aos de edad y es viuda y tiene 8 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de papa,maz,cereal y trigo, ella vende en el mercado de Urubamba en forma ambulatoria desde las 6:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m, la socia tiene una tierra de cultivo donde siembra papa y maz, tambin en algunas oportunidades la socia lleva a vender a lugares como Calca y Cusco, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de venta de cereales. La socia solicita el prstamo para comprar cereales como papa, maz y trigo al por mayor.
La socia est feliz por el prstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Guillermina belongs to the Perolniyoc Communal Bank. The bank is located in the Urubamba district, Urubamba province, Cusco department.
Guillermina, age 46, is a widow and has eight children. She alternates her daily activities with her business of selling potatoes, corn, grains, and wheat. She sells in an itinerant manner at the Urubamba market. She sells from 6:00 a.m. until 5:00 p.m.
She has land where she grows potatoes and corn. Sometimes she takes her products to sell in places like Calca and Cusco.
She wants to expand her business of selling grains. She is requesting the loan to buy grains like potatoes, corn, and wheat wholesale.
She is happy about the loan, and she pledges to make her payments.

loan.use: to buy grains like potatoes, corn, and wheat wholesale.

loan.name: Katherin Gabriela

texts.es:
Gabriela es una madre joven de 21 aos de edad, tiene un hijo con el que vive en casa de sus abuelos ubicada en el distrito de San Jos en Pacasmayo La Libertad.
Gabriela se dedica a la venta de abarrotes (arroz, huevo, aceite, azcar, fideos, etc.), golosinas y bebidas en una bodega instalada en su propio domicilio. Su bodega cuenta con una gran demanda para la satisfaccin de Gabriela.
Gabriela solicita a Edpyme Alternativa un crdito de 1200 nuevos soles para invertir en el surtimiento de su negocio. Ella desea comprar nuevos productos y de marcas variadas para mantener a sus clientes satisfechos.
Gabriela desea obtener mayores ganancias para poder mejorar la calidad de vida de ella y de su pequeo hijo. Ella es muy conocida en su zona y es una persona de buenas referencias personales y laborales.
texts.en: Gabriela is a young mother of 21 years of age. She has one son and she lives with him in his grandparents house in the district of San Jos in Pacasmayo-La Libertad. Gabriela works selling groceries (rice, eggs, oil, sugar, noodles, etc), candies, and drinks, in a store that she runs in her home. To her satisfaction, there is a lot of demand for her store. Gabriela has requested a loan of $450 from Edpyme Alternativa so that she can supply her store. She wants to buy new products and more brands so she can keep her customers satisfied. Gabriela wants to increase her income so that she can have a better quality of life for her and her little son. She is well know in her neighborhood and has good personal and work references.

loan.use: to supply her store.

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: to buy watermelons, melons, oranges, avocados, mangos, cabbage, tomatoes, onions and potatoes

loan.name: Mwanamimi

texts.en:
Mwanamimi is a married woman with seven children, three of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.
For the past 14 years, Mwanamimi has operated a retail shop business, selling household consumption items retail and wholesale to her neighbours and passersby. In addition she also sells coconut, her other source of income. She dreams of expanding her business in the future.
With the Kshs 80,000 she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, sugar, cooking oil and coconuts for sale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loan.use: To purchase bundles of wheat flour, sugar, cooking oil and coconuts for sale.

loan.name: Kazi Ni Kazi Group

texts.en:
Mariam, who is in her early 30s is single with one child who is still going to school. She has been running two businesses, selling bites and second hand clothes for 7 years now. She works from 6.30am to 5.00pm daily and is able to make a small monthly profit.
This will be Mariam's 9th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to increase the food she sells and started selling clothes. She also started building her house and has paid back all her loans successfully. She is asking for a loan to buy and sell more clothes. Her dream is to one day finish building her house.
Mariam will share this loan with her loan group "Kazi ni Kazi" which has 15 members, who will hold each other accountable for paying back their loans.

loan.use: To buy and sell more clothes.

loan.name: Abizeranye Group

texts.fr: Valens est client dACB depuis 2011,il est cultivateur de lgumineuses, il est membre du groupe Abizeranye, il est n au Rwanda, son ducation est de 8 ans de lcole primaire, il est mari, il a 33 ans, il a 4 enfants entre 7 et 2 an, 2 de ses enfants va lcole. Cest son premier cycle de prt, Valens va utiliser le prt pour lagriculture de lgumineuses et payer la main duvre et achat dengrais chimique et la semence. Sa stratgie est dtendre le terrain cultiv pour augmenter la production. Dans lavenir, le profit va lui aider de construire une maison dhabitation de sa famille.
texts.en: Valens has been an ACB customer since 2011. He grows legumes (peas, beans etc) for a living, and is a member of the Abizeranye group. He was born in Rwanda, and attended primary school for eight years. He is married, 33 years old and has four children between two and seven years old, two of whom attend school. This is the first loan that he has sought. Valens will use the loan to boost his legumes production and to pay for labour costs, chemical fertilisers and seeds. His aim is to extend his land so that he can boost production. In future, he would like to use the profits from his business in order to build a home for his family.

loan.use: to pay labour costs and to purchase seeds and fertilisers

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: To purchase more supplies.

loan.name: Jos Edgardo

texts.es:
Jos Edgardo tiene 33 aos, es casado vive con la esposa y con los hijos en el Cantn Chillanes Provincia de Bolvar tiene dos hijos.
Los miembros de la V.R.C. COOPERATIVA Patrn San Miguel se encuentra ubicada en el recinto Pailaloma a 60 minutos de la oficina pertenece al Cantn Chillanes, esta ventanilla de 13 miembros se dedica a las labores agrcolas de cultivos de maz, papas y trigo.
Jos se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maz, papas y trigo, los productos los compra en Chillanes y en San Pablo cada fin de mes y los vende en la feria de los domingos en Chillanes.
Solicita el crdito para la comprar de insumos para los cultivos adems de fertilizantes y abonos. Con el apoyo del crdito le ayudara econmicamente para suplir sus necesidades y aumentar la produccin. Enfrentar desafos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueo es dar el estudio a los hijos y mejorar la calidad de vida.
Es una persona responsable y horada, le gusta jugar vley, festejar carnaval.
texts.en:
Jos Edgardo is 33 years old, married, and lives with his wife and children in Chillanes canton, in Bolvar province. He has two children.
The 'Patrn San Miguel' community bank is located in Pallaloma, 60 minutes from our Chillanes office. The community bank has 13 members who work in agriculture, growing corn, potatoes and wheat.
Jos is a farmer who grows corn, potatoes and wheat. He buys his products in Chillanes and San Pablo every month end and sells his products in the Sunday market in Chillanes.
Jos is requesting this loan to buy supplies and fertilizers for his crops. The support of this loan will help him to financially cover his needs and increase his production. Jos faces challenges in his business such as pests, plant diseases and changes in the weather. His dream is to provide his children with an education and to improve their quality of life.
Jos is a responsible and honest person who enjoys playing volleyball and celebrating Carnival.

loan.use: to buy supplies and fertilizers for his crops

loan.name: Josselito Miguel

texts.es:
Josselito Miguel tiene 21 aos, es soltero vive con los padres en el Cantn Chillanes Provincia de Bolvar, no tiene hijos.
Los miembros de la V.R.C. COOPERATIVA Patrn San Miguel se encuentra ubicada en el recinto Pailaloma a 60 minutos de la oficina pertenece al Cantn Chillanes, esta ventanilla de 13 miembros se dedica a las labores agrcolas de cultivos de maz, papas y trigo.
Josselito se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maz y trigo, los productos los compra en Chillanes y en San Pablo cada fin de mes y los vende en la feria de los domingos en Chillanes.
Solicita el crdito para la comprar de insumos para los cultivos adems de fertilizantes y abonos. Con el apoyo del crdito le ayudara econmicamente para suplir sus necesidades y aumentar la produccin. Enfrentar desafos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueo es tener sus propas tierras para seguir sembrando.
Le gusta trabajar, hacer depoerte estar con su familia por son muy alegres.
texts.en:
Josselito Miguel is 21 years old. He is single and lives with his parents in the Chillanes canton in the province of Bolivar. He has no children.
The members of the V.R.C. cooperative Patrn San Miguel can be found in the Pailaloma precinct, 60 minutes from the Chillanes canton office. This communal bank has 13 members who work in agriculture, cultivating corn, potatoes, and wheat.
Josselito works in agriculture. He plants corn and wheat. He buys products in Chillanes and in San Pablo at the end of every month and sells them at the Sunday fair in Chillanes.
He is applying for the loan to purchase items needed for his crops, in addition to fertilizer and compost. The loan will help him economically to supply his needs and to increase production. He faces challenges such as pests and diseases and the variation in the climate. His dream is to have his own lands to continue planting.
He likes to work, do sports, and be with his family, because they are very happy.

loan.use: to buy items needed for his crops, in addition to fertilizer and compost

loan.name: Somoye

texts.en:
Somoe, a married woman with four children, owns the family home that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family. For the past 10 years, Somoe has operated a bakery business, making and selling bread at the market to her neighbours and passersby. She also sells palm leaves. Somoe faces the major challenge of seasonality, as during the rainy season she experiences low customer turnout.

Having joined Yehu to access loans to boost her business, Somoe is requesting a loan of KES 15,000 to expand her business, purchase palm leaves, sacks of rice, sugar and yeast for her bakery. She dreams of becoming a big supplier in the future.

loan.use: to expand her business, purchase palm leaves, sacks of rice, sugar and yeast for her bakery.

loan.name: Manuel Mesias

texts.es:
Manuel Mesias tiene 29 aos, es soltero vive con los padres en el Cantn Chillanes Provincia de Bolvar, no tiene hijos.
Los miembros de la V.R.C. COOPERATIVA Patrn San Miguel se encuentra ubicada en el recinto Pailaloma a 60 minutos de la oficina pertenece al Cantn Chillanes, esta ventanilla de 13 miembros se dedica a las labores agrcolas de cultivos de maz, papas y trigo.
Manuel se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maz, papas y trigo, los productos los compra en Chillanes y en San Pablo cada fin de mes y los vende en la feria de los domingos en Chillanes.
Solicita el crdito para la comprar de insumos para los cultivos adems de fertilizantes y abonos. Con el apoyo del crdito le ayudara econmicamente para suplir sus necesidades y aumentar la produccin. Enfrentar desafos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueo es tener una casa propia.
Manuel se considera como una persona honesta y trabajadora, le gusta festejar el carnaval.
texts.en:
Manuel Mesias is 29 years old, single, and lives with his parents in the canton of Chillanes in Bolivar Province. He has no children.

The members of the Communal Bank Cooperativa Patrn San Miguel (St. Michaels Cooperative) meet in the neighborhood of Pailaloma, which is located 60 minutes away from the Cooperativa San Jose office in the canton of Chillanes. This Communal Bank has 13 members who engage in farm activities that involve growing corn, potatoes, and wheat.

Manuel is a farmer who grows corn, potatoes, and wheat. His supplies are purchased in Chillanes and San Pablo at the end of each month. He sells his goods at the fair every Sunday in Chillanes.

Manuel is requesting a loan to buy supplies for his crops, such as fertilizers and compost. The support from this loan will help him financially to access what he needs to increase production. Among the challenges he faces are pests, diseases, and changes in weather. His dream is to have a house of his own.

Manuel is considered to be an honest and hardworking person. He enjoys celebrating the Carnival festivities.

loan.use: to purchase fertilizers and compost.

loan.name: Bety Benedicta

texts.es:
Bety de 32 aos, es una mujer trabajadora que tiene un negocio de venta de comidas en su casa para poder ayudar en los gastos a su esposo ya que l es cerrajero.
En la actualidad trabaja desde muy temprano preparando la comida en su casa para vender los almuerzos a sus clientes. Trabaja desde las 05h00am hasta las 13h00pm todos los das. Vende desayunos, almuerzos. Tiene muchas aspiraciones con su negocio de venta de comida por eso quiere el prstamo para comprar pescados, arroz y otros vveres para hacer comidas que satisfagan a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Bety, age 32, is a hardworking woman who has a business selling food from her home. This allows her to help her husband, a locksmith, with the household expenses.

At the moment, she begins preparing food very early at her home so that she can sell lunches to her customers. Bety works every day from 5am to 1pm. She sells breakfast and lunch.

Bety has many aspirations for her food business, so she is requesting a loan to buy fish, rice, and other ingredients used in preparing the meals that will satisfy her customers.

loan.use: to purchase fish, rice, and other ingredients.

loan.name: Luz Marina

texts.es: Luz Marina vive en la hermosa ciudad de Cartagena de Indias, en el barrio el Socorro donde tiene un negocio llamado Festejarte dedicado a la organizacin de fiestas infantiles, negocio que le ha servido para apoyar la gestin de su hogar conformado por su esposo y sus tres hijos en las edades de 3 a 7 aos; Ella inici con un trampoln que ubicaba en los parques de barrios, gradualmente empez a alquilar esta infraestructura y fue comprando juegos infantiles que adicion y que hoy ofrece el servicio en las fiestas dirigidas a nios. Su credikiva es el primer financiamiento que recibe de la Fundacin Mario Santo Domingo con el cual comprar juegos de jardn para alquilar e invertir en volantes promocionales para dar a conocer su negocio. Su sueo es lograr tener una casa propia y est haciendo todos los esfuerzos en familia para lograrlo, as como llevar a que sus hijos disfruten de bienestar y principalmente que tengan una educacin de calidad.
texts.en:
Luz Marina lives in the neighborhood of Socorro in the beautiful city of Cartagena de Indias. She has a business called Festejarte which organizes childrens parties. This business has helped to support her household, which consists of her husband and three children who range in age from 3 to 7.

She started with a trampoline that she brought to the neighborhood parks. Luz gradually began renting equipment and then bought additional childrens games.
