This is the first loan Fundacin Mario Santo Domingo has granted her and shell use it to buy raw materials in large volume to save on costs taking advantage of discounts offered by suppliers for bulk purchases. She will also buy plastic tables and chairs to increase access possibilities for new customers who often leave because all the seats are occupied.
Her dream is to install her infrastructure in a strategic spot with wider reach to become visually recognized from the beginning and not through referrals which is whats been helping her sales grow to date.

loan.use: to buy raw materials in bulk to take advantage of discounts offered by suppliers and also to buy plastic tables and chairs.

loan.name: Dayci Araceli

texts.es:
En la hermosa ciudad de Baha De Caraquez, conocida por sus playas, por su rica gastronoma y por la calidez de su gente, cada quine das se renen las socias del Banco Comunal Marianita de Jess.
En este lugar conocimos a la seora Daysi, tiene 34 aos de edad, est casada y de esta relacin tienen dos hijos de 15 y 13 aos de edad, los mismos que estudian en colegio. Su esposo se dedica a la pesca.
Ella adems de realizar las labores de su hogar tambin se dedica al comercio y realiza los quehaceres domsticos de otras casas. Comparte su tiempo entre sus trabajos y sus ventas ya que en las maanas tiene que ir a una casa a realizar los quehaceres domsticos y tambin realiza la limpieza de un departamento que tiene a su cargo. Despus de realizar estas labores ella se desplaza puerta a puerta ofreciendo sus productos, vende zapatillas y productos Yanbal (artculos de belleza, cosmticos perfumera y accesorios para damas). Sus productos los deja a crdito a sus clientes y cobra cada semana, nos cuenta que lleva un ao vendiendo los productos Yanbal mientras que lo que es zapatillas recin lleva seis meses.
Este crdito lo va a emplear en comprar perfumes, cremas, bisutera y zapatillas. Est en el Banco Comunal hace dos ciclos, es la fiscal de pagos del banco y le gusta porque se lleva bien con sus compaeras y ha hecho ms amigas.
Sus sueos son seguir trabajando y aumentar sus ventas.
texts.en:
In the beautiful city of Baha De Caraquez, known for its beaches, rich cuisine and for the warmth of its people, the "Marianita de Jess" communal bank meets every two weeks.
We met Daysi, 34, here. Shes married and has two children who are 15 and 13 years of age; they both are in middle school. Her husband is a Fisherman.
Besides doing her household chores, she also is a merchant and does domestic work in other houses. She shares her time among her jobs and her sales because in the morning she has to go to a house to do domestic chores and she also cleans an apartment thats in her care. After doing these chores she goes door to door offering her products. She sells sandals and Yanbal brand products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes and womens accessories.) She sells on credit and collects payment weekly. She tells us that shes been selling Yanbal for a year but has only been selling the sandals for six months.
She will use this loan to buy perfume, creams, costume jewelry and sandals. Shes been in the communal bank since two cycles ago. She is the Payments Supervisor in the bank and likes it because she gets along well with her fellow members and shes made new friends. Her dream is to continue working and increase sales.

loan.use: to buy perfume, creams, costume jewelry and sandals.

loan.name: Luis Alexander

texts.es:
Luis tiene 21 aos de edad, l es soltero, cuenta con casa propia ubicada en la zona rural del distrito de Olmos, cuenta con servicios de agua y luz, el lugar es una comunidad pequea con un aproximado de 200 familias.
Luis se gana la vida desde hace 2 aos criando y vendiendo animales menores en corrales ubicados en la parte posterior de su domicilio, el suele criar ganado porcino, ovino y pavos y patos los alimenta con granos y pastos naturales, cuando estos ya han alcanzado un buen punto de desarrollo las ofrece en venta a los negociantes que siempre visitan la zona en donde vive. Cuenta con ingresos adicionales de labores en agricultura.
Luis est solicitando un prstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 3000 nuevos soles para que pueda invertir en la compra de animales para su comercializacin ymejoramiento de sus tierras de cultivo. Este negocio cuenta con competencia pero tambin cuenta con un amplio mercado para su comercializacin.
luis es una persona responsable y puntual, adems cuenta con muy buenas referncias.
texts.en:
Luis tiene 21 aos de edad, l es soltero, cuenta con casa propia ubicada en la zona rural del distrito de Olmos, cuenta con servicios de agua y luz, el lugar es una comunidad pequea con un aproximado de 200 familias.
Luis se gana la vida desde hace 2 aos criando y vendiendo animales menores en corrales ubicados en la parte posterior de su domicilio, el suele criar ganado porcino, ovino y pavos y patos los alimenta con granos y pastos naturales, cuando estos ya han alcanzado un buen punto de desarrollo las ofrece en venta a los negociantes que siempre visitan la zona en donde vive. Cuenta con ingresos adicionales de labores en agricultura.
Luis est solicitando un prstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 3000 nuevos soles para que pueda invertir en la compra de animales para su comercializacin ymejoramiento de sus tierras de cultivo. Este negocio cuenta con competencia pero tambin cuenta con un amplio mercado para su comercializacin.
luis es una persona responsable y puntual, adems cuenta con muy buenas referncias.

loan.use: Compra de animales con sus respectivos alimentos y mejoramiento de sus tierras de cultivo.

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: to build a room at the front of his house.

loan.name: Estrella

texts.es: La seora Estrella tiene ya ms de cinco aos dedicndose a la venta de ropa usada y nueva. Esta solicitando un prstamo para invertir en compra de mercanca como es zapatos, ropa para nios, juguetes y ropa de temporada de verano. Con las ganancias que obtiene de las ventas de la mercanca sern para pagar el crdito, ya que su esposo el seor Eleuterio le ayudara con los gastos familiares y escolares de sus tres hijos. Desea tener mas ms mercanca para vender, para en un futuro tener un local fijo, ya que por el momento esta vendiendo la mercanca afuera de su casa.
texts.en:
For more than five years, Estrella has worked selling new and used clothing.
She is requesting a loan to invest in buying merchandise such as shoes, children's clothing, toys, and clothes for the summer season. With the earnings she obtains from selling the merchandise, she will pay off the loan, since her husband, Eleuterio, will help her with the family's expenses and the school costs for their three children.
She would like to have more merchandise to sell, and in the future she would like to have a permanent store, since for the time being she is selling her merchandise outside her house.

loan.use: to invest in merchandise for her clothing sales business.

payment.comment: Over-reported by partner. Reduced to local price.

loan.name: Ofelia

texts.en:
Ofelia is from the village of Palomoc, Titay, Zamboanga del Norte. She is 52 years old, married and has 4 adult children. To make a living, Ofelia owns and operates a general store selling a variety of different products. Ofelia has been engaged in her business for over 15 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month.
In 2011, Ofelia joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ofelia is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase products such as dry goods, canned goods and home cleaning supplies. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Ofelia from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income.
About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.
*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loan.use: to purchase products such as dry goods, canned goods and home cleaning supplies.

loan.name: Soeng

texts.en: Soeng is a local farmer who lives in the province of Kompong Cham. To make a living, she and her husband grow two rice crops a year, one during the rainy season and one during the dry season. They earn an average of $5 a day. Soeng will use her loan to buy a plot of fertile land from her neighbor in order to enlarge her rice crop planting. She can also rent the land to other villagers for a fee. Soeng is blessed with four children, three of whom are single and one is married.

loan.use: buy a plot of land

loan.name: Mom

texts.en:
Mom, age 55, is married and resides with her children in Kampong Chnang Province, Cambodia. Mom is a housewife. Her husband is a veterinarian, earning an income of $5.6 per day to help cover the family expenses. The family is also assisted by her children who are employed at the garment factory, earning an income of $3 each per day.
Their standard of living has been improved since the family has had these businesses.
She is requesting a loan of $1,000 to pay for one of her childrens wedding. This is her first loan from CREDIT, a partner of Kiva.

loan.use: to pay for one of her children's wedding.

loan.name: Josephine

texts.en:

To make a living, Josephine owns and operates a general store. Josephine has been engaged in her business for over seven years and earns approximately 4,500 PHP a month.
In 2010, Josephine joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. Josephine has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell.
Josephine is requesting a new loan of 9,500 PHP, which will be used to purchase more products such as canned and dry goods. This will be the fourth loan taken out by Josephine from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income.
About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.
*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loan.use: to purchase more products such as canned and dry goods.

loan.name: Sareoun

texts.en:
Sareoun, age 30, is married and resides with her children in Kampong Chnang Province, Cambodia.
Sareoun is employed at the factory, earning an income of $3 per day to help cover the family expenses. The family is also assisted by her husband, who is a construction worker, earning an income of $5 per day.
Their standard of living has been improved since the family has had these businesses.
She is requesting a loan of $400 to finish her construction of her house. This is her second loan from CREDIT, a partner of Kiva.

loan.use: to pay for the construction of her house.

loan.name: Sambath

texts.en:
Sambath, age 37, is married and resides with her children in Kampong Chnang Province, Cambodia.
Sambath is employed at the factory, earning an income of $3 per day to help cover the family expenses. The family is also assisted by her husband who is a mechanic, earning an income of $10 per day.
The standard of living has been improved since the family has had these businesses.
She is requesting a loan of $600 to pay for her childrens administration fee to work in South Korea. This is her second loan from CREDIT, a partner of Kiva.

texts.en:
Phalla, age 28, is married and resides with her children in Kampong Chnang Province, Cambodia.
Phalla is employed at the factory, earning an income of $3 per day to help cover the family expenses. The family is also assisted by her husband, who is a driver, earning an income of $5 per day.
The standard of living has been improved since the family has had these businesses.
She is requesting a loan of $800 to finish the construction of her house. This is her first loan from CREDIT, a partner of Kiva.

loan.name: Vat

texts.en:
The person shown in the picture is Vat, age 47. He lives in the province of Kompong Chhnang. He is a building worker in and around his village. From his job, he typically makes around $1.75 income each day to manage his family's daily expenses. To help better meet the family's demands, his wife makes Khmer cakes to sell and earns approximately $1.25 a day. This couple resides with their three children, two of whom are students and one has married and lives separately.
Vat has decided to seek a loan from Kiva to purchase more ingredients to make Khmer cake for sale and to buy zinc to cover the roof of his house that has cracked.

loan.use: buy ingredients to make cakes to sell and to repair house roof

loan.name: Nhor

texts.en: Nhor is 54 and resides in Prey Veng province, one of the largest rice producing regions in Cambodia. Nhor is a housewife and her husband is a construction worker, earning an income of USD 3 per day. Each month, the family spends USD 25 on food and USD 15 on other necessary expenses. Nhor is requesting a loan of USD 1000 to finish the construction of her house. This will be her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner.

loan.use: to finish the construction on her house

loan.name: Regina

texts.en: Regina is married with 4 children. Regina is 32 years old and lives in the Philippines. Regina is a farmer and plants and harvest rice to earn a living. She has been doing this for 5 years. She has requested a loan to purchase fertilizers. Regina has been a member of PMPC for one year.

loan.use: to purchase fertilizers

loan.name: Mory

texts.en:
Mory, 50, resides in Prey Veng province, Cambodia, an area known as one of the largest rice producing regions in Cambodia.
Mory is a housewife while her husband is a construction worker, earning an income of US $2 per day. Each month, the family has to spend US $25 on food and US $25 on the other necessary expenses.
Mory is requesting a loan of US $1,200 to finish the construction of her house. This will be her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner.

loan.use: to finish construction of her house.

loan.name: Merilyn

texts.en:
Merilyn is from the village of Katipa, Lopez Jaena. She is 51 years old. Merilyn is married and has four adult children.
To make a living, Merilyn owns and operates a general store. Merilyn has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month.
In 2006, Merilyn joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. Merilyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell.
Merilyn is requesting a new loan of 30,000 PHP which will be used to purchase more products such as canned and dry goods. This will be the sixth loan taken out by Merilyn from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.
About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: to buy a motorbike.

loan.name: Tey

texts.en:
Ty, 47, resides in Prey Veng province, Cambodia, an area known as one of the largest rice producing regions in Cambodia. Ty is a housewife and a farmer during rainy season while her husband is employed at a construction company, earning an income of USD 2 per day.
Each month, the family has to spend USD 45 on food and USD 25 on the other necessary expenses.
Ty is requesting a loan of USD 600 to purchase a mechanical plow to help plow the rice fields. This will be her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner.

loan.use: to buy a mechanical plow to help plow the rice fields.

loan.name: Januka

texts.en:
This is 40-year-old Januka. She is married and has one child, aged 16.
In 2005, she established her cow-raising business. Working seven days a week and four hours a day, she suports her family.
She has already received and successfully repaid two loans from Patan BPW. She used her most recent loan to buy a young milk-giving cow.
In the future, Januka plans to uplift the economic condition of her family. She thanks you for your support.
Dairy cows are an important source of nutrition and income in Nepal. Cows are never raised for beef, but for their milk, from which curd (duy) and fresh cheese (paneer) are made. Jersey cows are the preferred breed for milking. On average, a dairy cow in Nepal will produce about 10 liters of milk each day. In the local market, a liter of milk sells for about USD .50.
In addition to producing milk, cows provide dung that is used in home construction and as fuel for fires, and it can be captured in methane storage tanks. The purchase of a dairy cow, made possible through a Kiva loan, is an investment that will repay itself many times over.
This loan was administered by Kiva's local partner microfinance institution, Patan Business and Professional Women. Patan BPW became Kiva's first field partner in Nepal in 2007. Patan BPW operates throughout the Kathmandu Valley, offering microcredit and business training programs to low-income women. In addition to providing economic opportunity to their clients, Patan BPW seeks to empower Nepali women within the home and community.
For more information about Patan BPW, visit our partner page and keep an eye out for new loans and borrower updates: BPW Partner Page Join our lending team: BPW Lending Team.

loan.use: to buy a young milking cow.

loan.name: Enerio

texts.en:
Enerio is from the village of Silucap, Liloy, Zamboanga del Norte. He is 33 years old. Enerio is married and has three school-aged children.
To make a living, Enerio owns and operates a rice retail store in the local community. Enerio has been engaged in his business for over 11 years and earns approximately 30,000 PHP a month.
In 2010, Enerio joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his business and living situation. Enerio has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6,200 PHP from PMPC.
Enerio is requesting a new loan of 50,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase more sacks of rice for his rice retail store. This will be the fourth loan taken out by Enerio from PMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income.
About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.
*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loan.use: to purchase more sacks of rice for his rice retail store.

loan.name: Heng

texts.en: Mrs. Heng is a long-time businesswoman and a low-income person. She has been operating a retail business since the beginning of 2008. From the front of her house, she sells different kinds of merchandise to her neighbors and passing travelers. She sells items such as perfumes, beauty products, costume jewelry, cooking ingredients, fast food, plastic products, soft drinks, and other miscellaneous products. Her husband is a chicken breeder. They have one child who works as a car repairer in a local garage. In order to earn extra income, Mrs. Heng will be using the loan she requested to purchase piglets to raise.

loan.use: purchase piglets to raise

loan.name: Durga

texts.en:
This is 29-year-old Durga. She is married and has one child, aged 9.
In 2001, she established her vegetable farming business. Working seven days a week and five hours a day, she supports her family.
She has already received and successfully repaid five loans from Patan BPW. She used her most recent loan to buy seeds and fertilizers.
In the future, Durga plans to uplift the economic condition of her family. She thanks you for your support.
Over 70% of Nepal's economy is agricultural. Typically, Nepali households grow crops on small plots of terraced land. Rice (bhat), lentils (daal), and vegetables (thakari) are the staples of the Nepali diet.
With a Kiva loan, BPW's borrowers are able to purchase greater amounts of seed and fertilizer. With more seeds and fertilizer, a borrower is able to grow cash crops to be sold in the local market. Such crops allow households to move beyond subsistence and provide much-needed cash income throughout the year.
This loan was administered by Kiva's local partner microfinance institution, Patan Business and Professional Women. Patan BPW became Kiva's first field partner in Nepal in 2007. Patan BPW operates throughout the Kathmandu Valley, offering microcredit and business training programs to low-income women. In addition to providing economic opportunity to their clients, Patan BPW seeks to empower Nepali women within the home and community. For more information about Patan BPW, visit our partner page and keep an eye out for new loans and borrower updates: BPW Partner Page Join our lending team: BPW Lending Team"

loan.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers.

She has already received and successfully repaid five loans from Patan BPW. She used her most recent loan to buy a young milk-giving cow.
In the future, Niru plans to uplift the economic condition of her family. She thanks you for your support.
Dairy cows are an important source of nutrition and income in Nepal. Cows are never raised for beef, but for their milk, from which curd (duy) and fresh cheese (paneer) are made. Jersey cows are the preferred breed for milking. On average, a dairy cow in Nepal will produce about 10 liters of milk each day. In the local market, a liter of milk sells for about USD .50.
In addition to producing milk, cows provide dung that is used in home construction and as fuel for fires. It can also be captured in methane storage tanks. The purchase of a dairy cow, made possible through a Kiva loan, is an investment that will repay itself many times over.
This loan was administered by Kiva's local partner microfinance institution, Patan Business and Professional Women. Patan BPW became Kiva's first field partner in Nepal in 2007. Patan BPW operates throughout the Kathmandu Valley, offering microcredit and business training programs to low-income women. loan.name: Oprecida

texts.en:
Oprecida is from the village of San Francisco, Liloy, Zamboanga del Norte. She is 53 years old. Oprecida is single.
To make a living, Oprecida owns and operates a general store. Oprecida has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month for these activities.
In 2010, Oprecida joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. Oprecida has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC.
Oprecida is requesting a new loan of 14,900 PHP, which will be used to purchase more products such as canned and dry goods and house chore needs. This will be the fourth loan taken out by Oprecida from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to save as a reserve for future emergencies.
About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loan.use: to purchase more products such as canned and dry goods and house chore needs.

location.town: San Francisco, Liloy, Zamboanga del Norte

loan.name: Sangita

texts.en:
This is 42 year-old Sangita. She is married and has three children (24, 20 and 17). In 2003, she established her poultry farming business. In the Kathmandu Valley, raising poultry for eggs and meat is a very profitable business. Sangita works seven days a week and five hours a day to support her family. She has successfully repaid six loans from Patan BPW, and her most recent loan was used to buy small chickens. In the future, Sangita plans to uplift the economic condition of her family. She thanks you for your support.
Kiva loans are used to purchase chicks, food, and necessary medicine to keep the chickens healthy. Once matured, the chickens are sold at small butcher shops or in the many open air markets throughout the valley.

loan.use: to buy small chickens

loan.name: Sok

texts.en: Mr. Sok is a 42-year-old married man who works in a rubber plant in the province of Siem Reap. From this, he earns an income of around $4.25 each day to use for the family's daily expenses. To earn more income, Mr. Soks wife has been planting a few fruit trees on their land. They are blessed with two children who are studying in the local school and depend on their income for support. The rainy season is approaching, so Mr. Sok has requested a loan to plant potatoes.

loan.use: plant potatoes

loan.name: Amarsanaa

texts.en: Mr. Amarsanaa is 34 years old, lives with his wife and 2 children in Kherlen city of Dornod Aimag, the far eastern province of Mongolia which is 750 km away from the capital city. They live in rented apartment at the moment and they have a dream to have their own family house. Amarsanaas 2 children attend a secondary school. Amarsanaa has been working for 6 years as a baker in his sisters bakery. His wife runs a taxi business using her family car. Amarsanaa always dreamed of having his own pig farm so he decided to start a pig farming business. He has already made some financial projections and market research. The loan Amarsanaa is taking will be used to buy a couple of piglets and start fulfilling his dream to have a pig farming business.

loan.use: to buy a couple of piglets and start fulfilling his dream to have a pig farming business

loan.name: Abibatu Z

texts.en:
This is 45-year-old Abibatu. She is married, and has 6 children ages 28, 24, 20, 16, 13 and 6 years old. She has one additional dependent, her niece, who lives with her.
In 2004, Abibatu established her drugstore business. She began her business after training and becoming a qualified nurse. Working 7 days a week and 8 hours a day, she earns about 900,000 SLL every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of 3,000,000 SLL. Abibatu requires a loan in order to buy additional essential drugs for her business. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately 200,000 SLL.
In the future, Abibatu plans to educate her children to any level of education they wish to attain. She thanks you for your support.

loan.use: to pay for essential drugs for her business

loan.name: Eustaquia

texts.en:
Eustaquia is 50 years old and married. She has 3 children ages 24, 20 and 16. Her husband works as a farmer.
Eustaquia has a food-vending business. She makes rice cakes, banana and camote cue, and other delicacies. She goes around her community to sell what she makes. Eustaquia also buys and resells vegetables.
Eustaquia requested a loan to purchase raw ingredients such as flour, sugar and bananas. She also plans to use part of her loan to buy fertilizers for the farm her husband tills. Eustaquia plans to renovate their house in the near future.

loan.use: to purchase raw ingredients such as flour, sugar and bananas

loan.name: Michael

texts.en:
This is 51-year-old Michael. He is married and has three children, aged 11, 7 and 4 years. He has four additional dependents who live with him because they are his late brothers children.
In 2009, Michael established his rice business. He began his business because he needed a reliable means of getting income to support his family. Working seven days a week and 10 hours a day, he earns about 900,000 Sierra Leone leones (Le) every month from this business.
He would like a loan in the amount of Le 4,500,000. Michael requires a loan in order to buy additional bags of rice for his business. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately Le 200,000. In the future, Michael plans to extend his business and to educate his children. He thanks you for your support.

loan.use: to pay for additional local foodstuffs.

loan.name: Dioscora

texts.en:
Fifty-nine-year-old Dioscora is a married woman who lives in the town of Trinidad, Bohol.
Dioscora is engaged in farming and the hog-raising business. She helps her husband grow rice at their farm. She raises her pigs in her backyard piggery. Dioscora works hard to provide for her family. She said she wants her children to be able to eat three times a day.
Dioscora has requested a loan and plans to use it to purchase piglets, feeds and fertilizers. She hopes for a stable business for her family.

loan.use: to purchase piglets, feeds and fertilizers.

loan.name: Davaasuren

texts.en: Davaasuren, 32, is married and lives with her husband and two sons, aged 6 and 9. The family lives in a ger, a traditional Mongolian felt tent, in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Both of her sons attend a local primary school. Davaasuren is a professional tailor. Davaasuren supports her family by operating her handmade kids shoes business with help from her husband. She sews kids shoes to sell them at Narantuul, the largest outdoor market in Mongolia. When she first began her business in 2004, she sold her handmade shoes at a cheap price. Now her skill is high and her handmade shoes are quality and daedal (finely and skillfully made), so demand for her handmade shoes is high in Narantuul. She purchases her materials from Narantuul. Davaasuren is requesting a loan of 700,000 Mongolian tugriks (MNT) to purchase more shoe materials to make shoes before the Mongolian national celebration, called Naadam, because demand for this shoe rises during this celebration. Davaasuren wants to improve her business with this loan.

loan.use: To purchase more shoe materials to make kid's shoes.

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: To pay for additional bales of used clothing

loan.name: Nary

texts.en: Nary, 35, resides in Prey Veng province, Cambodia, an area known as one of the largest rice producing regions in Cambodia. Nary sells groceries and is a cleaner for a private company, earning an income of USD 2 per day. Each month, the family has to spend USD 83 on food and USD 25 on other necessary expenses. Nary is requesting a loan of USD 1200 to purchase a stand at the market to start a new business by selling groceries. This will be her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner.

loan.use: to buy a stand at the market to sell groceries

loan.name: Emely

texts.en:
Emely is from the town of Lopez Jaena, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental. She is 49 years old. Emely is married and has 3 adult-age children. To make a living, Emely owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a general store in the local community. Emely has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 15,000 PHP a month for these activities.
In 2008, Emely joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Emely has successfully repaid a previous loan of 50,000 PHP from PMPC. Emely is requesting a new loan of 50000 PHP which will be used to purchase more products such as can goods, dry goods, and home products. This loan will be the 9th loan taken out by Emely from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.
About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.
